what is a supernova: A supernova is a powerful explosion of a dying star.
what is photosynthesis: Photosynthesis is the process by which plants convert sunlight into energy.
how many bones are in the adult human bo: There are 206 bones in the adult human body.

who wrote to kill a mockingbird: Harper Lee wrote To Kill a Mockingbird.

what is the currency of mexico: The currency of Mexico is the Peso.
what is the main gas in the earth's atmo: Nitrogen is the main gas in Earth's atmosphere.
what is the largest human bone: The femur is the largest bone in the human body.

what is the capital of brazil: The capital of Brazil is Brasília.
what is the main ingredient in guacamole: Avocado is the main ingredient in guacamole.
what is the currency of the united kingd: The currency of the UK is the Pound Sterling.
who was the first female prime minister: Margaret Thatcher was the first female prime minister of the UK.
what is the capital of japan: The capital of Japan is Tokyo.
what is the most populated country in th: India is the most populated country in the world.
what is the largest bird in the world: The ostrich is the largest bird in the world.

what is the capital of south korea: The capital of South Korea is Seoul.
who was the first president of the unite: George Washington was the first president of the United States.

what is the largest city in the world by: Tokyo, Japan is the largest city by population.
what is the capital of egypt: The capital of Egypt is Cairo.
what is the largest continent by area: Asia is the largest continent by area.
what is the capital of india: The capital of India is New Delhi.
what is the largest state in the united: Alaska is the largest U.S. state by area.
how does gravity work: Gravity is the force that attracts objects with mass toward each other.
why do birds migrate: Birds migrate to find food and suitable breeding conditions.
how do vaccines protect us: Vaccines train the immune system to recognize and fight pathogens.
what causes earthquakes: Earthquakes are caused by tectonic plate movements.
why do we yawn: Yawning may help regulate brain temperature and increase alertness.
how do submarines dive and surface: Submarines use ballast tanks to control buoyancy.
what is the function of the liver: The liver detoxifies chemicals and metabolizes drugs.
how do clouds form: Clouds form when water vapor condenses into droplets.
why do some animals hibernate: Animals hibernate to conserve energy during winter.
how does a compass work: A compass aligns with Earth's magnetic field to point north.
what is the greenhouse effect: The greenhouse effect traps heat in Earth's atmosphere.
how do fish breathe underwater: Fish use gills to extract oxygen from water.
why do we blink: Blinking keeps our eyes moist and clean.
how does a camera capture an image: A camera focuses light onto a sensor or film.
what causes rainbows: Rainbows are caused by light refraction in water droplets.
why do we have fingerprints: Fingerprints help with grip and are unique for identification.
how does sound travel: Sound travels as vibrations through a medium.
what causes seasons: Seasons are caused by Earth's tilt and orbit around the sun.
how do spiders spin webs: Spiders use silk from spinnerets to spin webs.
why do volcanoes erupt: Volcanoes erupt due to pressure from magma beneath Earth's crust.
how does the brain send signals: The brain uses electrical impulses and neurotransmitters.
why do we need sleep: Sleep helps the body recover and consolidate memories.
how do plants reproduce: Plants reproduce via seeds, spores, or vegetative methods.
why do stars twinkle: Stars twinkle due to atmospheric turbulence.
how does a refrigerator keep food cold: Refrigerators use coolant to absorb and release heat.
why do we get hiccups: Hiccups are caused by diaphragm spasms.
how do satellites stay in orbit: Satellites balance gravity and forward motion to stay in orbit.
why do leaves fall off trees: Leaves fall to conserve energy during winter.
how does sunscreen protect skin: Sunscreen blocks or absorbs UV radiation.
how do birds fly: Birds fly by generating lift with their wings.
why do we have eyebrows: Eyebrows protect eyes from moisture and aid expression.
how does a parachute slow descent: Parachutes increase air resistance to slow descent.
why do dogs wag their tails: Dogs wag tails to communicate emotions.
how do mirrors reflect light: Mirrors reflect light at equal angles from a smooth surface.
why do we get goosebumps: Goosebumps are a reflex to cold or emotional stimuli.
how does a battery produce electricity: Batteries convert chemical energy into electrical energy.
why do we burp: Burping releases air from the stomach.
how do whales communicate: Whales use vocalizations like clicks and songs.
why do we cry when chopping onions: Onions release gas that irritates the eyes.
how does a GPS work: GPS uses satellite signals to determine location.
